name: Inky and the Hotdog Versus Woodpeckers in Space
name_original: Inky and the Hotdog Versus Woodpeckers in Space
description:
Inky and the Hotdog Versus Woodpeckers in Space (aka Inky Hotdog) was an old game I made in GameMaker way back in 2009. Ten years later I rediscovered it among some old files. With some tweaks and updates I am finally releasing it to the world for free (although you're more than welcome to donate some coinage if you like the game).

So what is the game about? Well, you play as Inky (an octopus) who is trying to get his hotdog back from some thieving woodpeckers. In space. Platforming shenanigans ensue.

Is it a great game? Nah. But considering I was only 12-13 at the time it's a miracle it's as unbroken as it is. And despite all the fixes and such the game still remains true to it's original form. 

As simple as the game is it holds a certain amount of charm, at least to me. When I made it I was very limited in what I could do (due to my ignorance of programming and such), but ironically those limitations helped to make a game that isn't bogged down with unnecessary bullsh*t. You can quite literally start playing the moment it finishes loading up until you complete it.

So I present to you a challenge - can you work your way through all 43 levels to get your hotdog back? Considering there's no save feature and that many of the levels are tough as nails I kinda doubt it.

Features:

  • 2D platforming action
  • That's really it...
  • Oh, you get to stomp on the woodpeckers, that's pretty cool

Requirements:

  • If you have a computer with XP or above you can run this, if you can't you really need to get a new computer
  • No idea if it runs on computers past Windows 7 though
  • Lots of patience
